body.name: Antec Vertical GPU Mount, PCIE 4.0 Riser Cable High Speed Flexible Extender Card Extension Port 90 Degree 200mm, White (GPU Vertical Mount only Support Full-Break PCIE Expansion Slot)
features: Compatible with RTX3090, RTX3080, RTX3070, RTX3060TI, RX6900XT, RX6800 ; Supports PCIE 4.0/3.0/2.0/1.0 ; Compatible with the most GPU / MOBO and PC Cases.
With movable bracket, More flexible in using PC case interior space.NOTE: Please check your case with enough space.
High stability and full PCIe Gen4 x16 speed, plug and play. Backward-compatible with PCIE 3.0/PCIE 2.0/PCIE 1.0.
Gold-Plated Pin Connections: Gold-plated PCI pins allow maximum durability with a rated 400g of retention force per contact pair.
Ultimate High Speed: The extender is capable of expanding bandwidth up to 16Gbps and beyond, featuring extremely fast graphic data transmission.

productInformation.name: Customer Reviews
productInformation.value: 3.9 3.9 out of 5 stars 242 ratings 3.9 out of 5 stars

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Installation guide 1. Remove all PCI slots blank. 2. Mount the screw of riser cable. 3. Mount the bracket to the case. 4. Connect GPU to the riser cable.

Antec PCI-E 4.0 Riser Cable with Adjustable Bracket Antec PCI-E 4.0 Riser Cable with Adjustable Bracket White Antec PCI-E 4.0 Riser Cable with Bracket Antec PCI-E 4.0 Riser Cable with Bracket White Antec PCI-E 4.0 Riser Cable Antec PCI-E 4.0 Riser Cable White Bracket Adjustable Bracket Adjustable Bracket L-shaped Bracket L-shaped Bracket PCI-e 4.0 4.0 4.0 4.0 4.0 4.0 Cable Length 200 mm 200 mm 200 mm 200 mm 200 mm 200 mm Color Black White Black White Black White

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 4, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Works with RTX 4090 no issues, don't listen to the less experienced builders who tell you it doesn't. Mine was a Gigabyte Gaming OC 4090 in a Corsair 5000x case. I would say the toughest part is if your case doesn't fit this perfectly, you'll have to mod your case a bit, but that's with most of these vertical brackets unless you get a huge one that takes up a ton of space but is adjustable. Also, you can clearly see it will take all your slots, so don't complain when pictures clearly show that with almost every vertical mount except the large adjustable ones. I needed a clean tight fit with a good riser cable and this was closest of all the mounts I tried. No I structuons which also sucks, but anyone with any experience will figure it out quickly. Good luck, just wanted to share this mount is solid, well built, no sag, stays far away from glass panel but is a bit of a pain to install in some cases.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 18, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Please read below before buying
reviews.reviewText: This mount was made very well but its not made for every pc case. If you are not buying a antec case pls do not buy if you dont want to do any modification for it to fit. At first i thought it was a universal mount but when i tried to install it on my pc case(thermaltake core p3) it wouldnt fit.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 19, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Easy to install, meets PCIE 4 standard, but only just barely!
reviews.reviewText: I have run numerous vertical GPU mounts over the past view years and this is indeed a complete package option that works well with a variety of cases. I recently installed it into a 500D Airflow with a few modifications to the existing knockout panels on the back of the case. It will pass enough buss speed to keep up with a liquid cooled RTX 3090 Kingpin... HOWEVER, It will cause problems with a RTX 4090, even at 90% power and undervolted I still got instability, the occasional crash from GPU device failure, and numerous frame errors in the 3D Mark family of benchmarks. Bypassing the cable (on 2 separate orders and a dedicated 15cm cable) and plugging the card directly into the motherboard resulted in no further errors, no crashes, and scores in the upper 99.3% in 3D Mark, Time Spy Extreme, and Port Royal.Works with 4080 and below, don't count on it for a 4090 though!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 25, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Very tight fit with a 40 Series card and B550 motherboard. Had to cut up the bracket to squeeze it in and get it to align properly. Everything was pretty well built and the cable seems very high quality.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 30, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Okay bracket, garbage cable
reviews.reviewText: I bought this bracket to install into my white Fractal Design Pop XL Air case. As many others have stated, no instructions were included, but with only a handful of screws it is kind of self-explanatory how it all goes together. That being said, the machining of the screw holes between the various pieces does not line up perfectly, so there is some manipulation required to get the thin metal pieces to go together. After some trial and error, I was able to get the bracket assembled. Installation into my particular case requires trimming the edges of the "fingers" that go into the expansion slot covers; that's not a fault of the bracket, as they can't engineer it to fit all variances between cases.The white color of the bracket is a great match to my case, and the aRGB base works as expected.The reason for 1 star is due to the cable. This cable is advertised as a PCIe 4.0 x16 cable, but mine only operated at x8 speeds. I initially thought it was due to both of my m.2 slots being used, but have since determined that is not the case; I can achieve x16 when the gpu is plugged directly into the motherboard. After about 4 months of use, my computer would no longer boot with a display, and after much troubleshooting I determined the riser cable was no longer operating. I disassembled the cheap plastic ends to expose the contacts between the ribbon cable and the contacts for the motherboard, and discovered that all of the contacts are secured with what appears to be hot glue, and that all the pins for the last ribbon cable were not aligned properly and each contact was bridging multiple pins, creating a short. The cable quality is poor.I've contacted Antec support via the email provided on Amazon. I was informed by a representative that I had to contact a different email address, which I did, and have not heard a response back. I will update the review if anything gets resolved, but at this time I'm not impressed with Antec at all.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 8, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars 5 stars, Pcie Cable is very stiff
reviews.reviewText: The media could not be loaded. fits in my h5 flow perfectly, the only complaint i have is that the mount sits a little close to my mobo so it was a bit of a hassle connecting the Pcie cable and getting it behind the gpu. other than that it looks great and works flawlessly

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 13, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Soon i install works without problem i was thinking to change just cable but it works with antec cable excellent brocket keeping storng rtx 4080 strix.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 4, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 2.0 out of 5 stars didn’t work came defective
reviews.reviewText: Fit my pc perfectly but I didn’t work I would have it set up and nothing would show on the monitor I tested this multiple times with different graphics cards and normally with just my motherboard and nothing maybe I got it defective.
